5cc8e551a8c8944abb62f881268459aad0cefe25: Ikigai is the Japanese concept of a personal “reason for being” – a sense of purpose that gives meaning to each day and contributes to long‑term well‑being. It is written 生き甲斐 (life + worthwhile) and is thought to lie deep within each person, guiding their actions and giving satisfaction, happiness, and meaning to life. [2] [3]
3614862d3fef80a40afd802b55fc6df47bd13d31: Ikigai is the Japanese idea of a personal “reason for being” – the purpose or sense of worth that motivates you to get up each day. It literally combines the characters for “life” (生き) and “worthwhile” (甲斐), meaning a life that is worthwhile and meaningful [1], [3]. In Okinawan culture, discovering one’s ikigai is seen as key to long, happy living and continuous activity even beyond retirement [2].
